attributes.action: Revive The British Home Nations Championship for Summer 2008!
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The British Home Nations Championship was the oldest tournament of its kind. The last time a Home Nations Championship was held was back in 1984 when Northern Ireland won the tournament on goal difference with a team including Martin O’Neill and Norman Whiteside.  Over the previous 100 years, England won the event on 54 occasions which was 13 more times than Scotland.

The British people are all disappointed that every one of the Home Nations has failed to qualify for Euro 2008.  The F.A is expected to lose in excess of £15 Million in lost revenue.

To maintain the outstanding momentum of British football fever, passion & patriotism, we, the British Public, ask for the support of the British Government to apply suitable & necessary pressure & guidance towards the F.A in order to stage such a tournament in Summer, 2008.

Although it is a matter for the F.A to decide; with the backing of a large proportion of the British Public & The British Government, we all hope the F.A will consider our request.

reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
